channel.title: no longer add virtual DVD drive to VM by default
channel.description:
Advantages:
* lower attack surface ([a virtual floppy drive had a vulnerability](https://venom.crowdstrike.com/)) * easier to parse output of `lsblk` for [livecheck](https://github.com/Whonix/whonix-xfce-desktop-config/blob/master/usr/share/livecheck/livecheck.sh) (testing whether all disks are set to read-only or not in [Whonix Live Mode](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Whonix_Live))
In VirtualBox:
``` lsblk --all ``` ``` NAME MAJ:MIN RM SIZE RO TYPE MOUNTPOINT sda 8:0 0 100G 1 disk └─sda1 8:1 0 100G 1 part /lib/live/mount/medium sr0 11:0 1 1024M 0 rom ```
sr0 is the virtual DVD drive and considered read-write (i.e. not read-only [RO]).
Disadvantages, the following will have worse usability:
* [Transfer files from the Host into Whonix-Gateway ™ or Whonix-Workstation ™ through ISO images](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/File_Transfer#Transfer_files_from_the_Host_into_Whonix-Gateway_.E2.84.A2_or_Whonix-Workstation_.E2.84.A2_through_ISO_images) * Boot from virtual DVD (for purposes of system recovery, data recovery, malware analysis, partitioning, and whatnot).
Users need to manually add a DVD drive but this can be added to user documentation.
* https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Template:VirtualBox_DVD_Add * https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Template:VirtualBox_DVD_Remove

item.description:
Advantages:

  • lower attack surface (a virtual floppy drive had a vulnerability)

In VirtualBox:

sda      8:0    0  100G  1 disk 
└─sda1   8:1    0  100G  1 part /lib/live/mount/medium

sr0 is the virtual DVD drive and considered read-write (i.e. not read-only [RO]).

  • Transfer files from the Host into Whonix-Gateway ™ or Whonix-Workstation ™ through ISO images
  • Boot from virtual DVD (for purposes of system recovery, data recovery, malware analysis, partitioning, and whatnot).

Users need to manually add a DVD drive but this can be added to user documentation.
